headline: CARNIVAL CORPORATION & PLC TO HOLD CONFERENCE CALL ON FOURTH QUARTER EARNINGS
summary: Carnival Corporation & plc (NYSE/LSE: CCL; NYSE: CUK) has scheduled a conference call with analysts for Friday, December 20, 2024, at 10 a.m. (EST); 3 p.m. (GMT) to discuss the company's fourth quarter financial results which are expected to be released that morning.

headline: Carnival price target raised to $32 from $27 at Stifel
summary: Stifel analyst Steven Wieczynski raised the firm’s price target on Carnival (CCL) to $32 from $27 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm is “cautiously optimistic/nervous heading into Carnival’s first crack at FY25 guidance, telling investors it “would not surprise us at all to see CCL’s initial FY25 guidance underwhelm current lofty expectations.” The firm believes buy-side expectations for FY25 EBITDA are somewhere in the $6.7B-$6.9B range, noting that consensus stands at about $6.7B.

headline: Carnival or Norwegian: Truist Chooses the Superior Cruise Stock to Buy
summary: A lot of attention has been focused on the recent election, but some of the more mundane market trends are still in play. Among these is the seasonal vacation season, now getting into full swing. Cruise stocks, in particular, have been charting an impressive course, and Truist analyst Patrick Scholes has taken notice. “Given the impressive performance of the cruise stocks over the past three months, compared to the S&P 500, we go into our conversations and ‘big data’ analysis with the mindset of

headline: Is Carnival a Buy, Sell, or Hold in 2025?
summary: Carnival (NYSE: CCL) (NYSE: CUK) has sailed through this year, reporting record revenue, soaring demand, and progress toward its long-term targets.  The health crisis temporarily halted sailings, and as a result, Carnival shifted to a loss and debt ballooned.  After such an increase this year, though, you may be wondering if Carnival will continue to advance in the coming months or if growth might taper off.
